page.title: 01Country south of Pembridge
page.content: This block, like its neighbour to the east, is truly rural. It contains one small village only, marston and a few isolated hamlets like Weston and Barewood ariculture is diversified. Cider trees grow west and south of pembridge and a small cider factory operates at Luntley. There are black curants, other soft fruits and vegetables at Barrow leasowes, a dairy farm at tibhall and mixed farming throughout the rest of the area. Though some hedges have gone in recent years, most remain, the patchwork of fields surviving despite the general use of combine harvesters. The most significant house is Luntley Court, unoccupied for the last ten yars. nearly all the farm cottages left empty by farm mechanisation have, in the last, twenty years, been bought, modernised and ocupied by people from
